profile.name: Christian Brauner
profile.bio: Software developer in Berlin. Core contributor to @lxc & Linux kernel. Passionate about containers, virtualization & system programming. Learning in public. 🐧☁️

tweets.content: I genuinely believe `systemd-nspawn` is an underappreciated gem for simple, robust containerization without the overhead. Great for quick tests or minimal environments. #Linux #Containers #systemd

Reflecting on the progress of container technology over the last decade. From nascent ideas to ubiquitous infrastructure. Proud to have played a small part with #LXC. What an incredible journey. #TechHistory
My relationship with `git blame` is complicated. Sometimes it's a diagnostic tool, sometimes it's a mirror reflecting my past self's questionable decisions. 😂 #DevLife #Git
Sometimes I feel like my job is 90% understanding cryptic error messages and 10% writing code. And 100% consuming coffee. ☕️ #DeveloperLife

Reading about the latest Linux kernel merge window. Always incredible to see the sheer volume and quality of work. Special shout-out to the ongoing efforts in security and memory management. 👏 #Linux #KernelDev
Finished reviewing a massive pull request for LXD. So much excellent work from the community! This is why open source is so powerful. Thanks to everyone contributing! 🙏 #OpenSource #LXD

Spent the afternoon mentoring a new contributor to LXC. Guiding them through the codebase and seeing their enthusiasm is one of the most rewarding parts of open source. 🌱 #Mentorship #OpenSourceCommunity

Thinking about the future of security in container runtimes. Sandboxing is key, but the attack surface with complex kernel interactions remains a huge challenge. Constant vigilance required! 🛡️ #ContainerSecurity #InfoSec
Just pushed a fix for that tricky cgroup v2 interaction bug in LXC. Should improve resource management for folks on newer kernels. Feels good to squash that one! 🐛 #LXC #LinuxKernel #OpenSource
Just wrestled with a subtle race condition in some C code for about 4 hours. The fix was a single `volatile` keyword. The absolute joy, and simultaneous frustration. 🤯 #Programming #Debugging
Excited to be submitting a talk proposal for #LinuxPlumbersConf! Thinking about the challenges of integrating modern kernel features into container runtimes. Wish me luck! 🤞 #OpenSource #LXC

Trying out a new editor setup today. It's amazing how much a fresh config can either boost productivity or completely break your flow for a few hours. Wish me luck on the latter! #Vim #Emacs #EditorWars (just kidding, mostly)
The best documentation is written for the maintainer who will inevitably forget how their own code works in 6 months. That maintainer is usually me. 😅 #DevHumor #Docs
Just got a bug report that involved a specific kernel version, a rare filesystem, and a full moon. Love these challenges! (Mostly kidding, mostly) 🌕 #BugHunt #Linux

Hot take: If your 'cloud-native' stack is slower and uses more resources than bare metal, you've missed a fundamental principle of engineering. Efficiency still matters, even with infinite cloud. ⚡️ #SystemsProgramming #DevOps #TechOpinion

Working on improving the snapshotting logic in LXC. It's always a delicate dance between consistency, performance, and user-friendliness. Any best practices for atomic operations on filesystems you'd recommend? #LXC #Containers

Diving deep into `io_uring` this week for a potential LXC performance optimization. The API is gnarly but the potential throughput gains are 🔥. Anyone else been playing with it? #LinuxKernel #io_uring #LXC
The satisfaction of optimising a critical path by even a few milliseconds in a systems-level component is just unmatched. It's the small wins that keep you going. ✨ #Performance #Optimization
